metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7472 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The KEYS subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.10.13 allows local users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a series of KEY_REQKEY_DEFL_THREAD_KEYRING keyctl_set_reqkey_keyring calls. Eric Biggers discovered a memory leak in the keyring implementation in the Linux kernel. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7472` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:
